intro: Bartsia inaequalis subsp. brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
